xxl.core.functions

Class DecoratorFunction<P,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.functions.DecoratorFunction<P,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the function's parameters.
    R - the return type of the function.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<P,R>, Decorator<Function<? super P,? extends R>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountingFunction, For, FunctionMetaDataFunction, Swapper

    public class DecoratorFunction<P,R>
extends Object
implements Function<P,R>, Decorator<Function<? super P,? extends R>>
    A decorator-function decorates (wraps) a function by passing given arguments to the invoke method of the wrapped function. To enhance the functionality of a function just inherit from this class and override the method of your choice.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Function<? super P,? extends R> function
      The function to be decorated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DecoratorFunction()
      Constructs a new decorator-function without a function to decorate.
      DecoratorFunction(Function<? super P,? extends R> function)
      Constructs a new decorator-function wrapping the given function.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Function<? super P,? extends R> getDecoree()
      Returns the decorated function.
      R invoke()
      Passes the (empty) argument to the decorated resp. wrapped function by calling the wrapped function's invoke method.
      R invoke(List<? extends P> arguments)
      Passes the arguments to the decorated resp. wrapped function by calling the wrapped function's invoke method.
      R invoke(P argument)
      Passes the argument to the decorated resp. wrapped function by calling the wrapped function's invoke method.
      R invoke(P argument0, P argument1)
      Passes the arguments to the decorated resp. wrapped function by calling the wrapped function's invoke method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecoratorFunction

        public DecoratorFunction(Function<? super P,? extends R> function)
        Constructs a new decorator-function wrapping the given function.
        Parameters:
        function - the function to be decorated or wrapped.

      • DecoratorFunction

        public DecoratorFunction()
        Constructs a new decorator-function without a function to decorate. This constuctor is only used by classes inherited from this class providing an enhanced functionality.

        Note: Do not use this constructor by calling it directly.
